frameDefinitions: An Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid Capture  or contact with a Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power.
A Theme that is in motion assumes a new Direction in which it moves.
A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.
Procedural or Medicine based Interventions are used on a Patient to attempt to alleviate a Medical_condition.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer believing that some Phenomenon will take place in the future.
An Experiencer does not achieve a Desired_goal.
frameExamples: We took our chances and <t>turned</t> right by a petrol station and, bingo, there she was--Fir Park.
Mo <t>dodged</t>  the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Evader</fen> moves under its own power to <fen>Capture</fen> or contact with the <fen>Pursuer</fen>. Normally the <fen>Evader</fen> frame element is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Pursuer</fen> is going after the <fen>Evader</fen> unless they act.
An actual or hypothetical  event in which the <fen>Pursuer</fen> takes physical control of the <fen>Evader</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the Evading occurs.

This is the object which moves. In many sentences this role will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this role is not <ment>required</ment> to be an animate mover, so it is different from a self-mover.
The new direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> continues its motion.
The time at which the change of direction takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the setting where the change of direction during the Theme's motion occurs.
The <fen>Dodger</fen> acts to avoid an oncoming <fen>Bad_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Bad_entity</fen> is  the oncoming entity to avoid.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the dodging occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the dodging occurs.
A drug or procedure is administered or performed in order to treat a <fen>Medical_condition</fen>.
The consequence of the <fen>Intervention</fen>.
A holistic description of the medical state of the patient (or a part of the state of the patient), which may or may not indicate the cause of a deviation from normal.
The individual or team that attempts to improve the medical condition of the <fen>Patient</fen>.

This is the person who believes some Phenomenon will take place in the future. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: <fex name='Cognizer'>Pat</fex> <t>expects</t> that the Yankees will win the World Series.

This is what the Cognizer believes will happen in the future. It can be expressed as a Finite Clause Complement, an NP Object, or a VP Complement with or without an NP Object (see General Grammatical Observations):
An entity that serves as the focus of a predicted <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the prediction.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> foresees the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> does not achieve a <fen>Desired_goal</fen>, or capture a pursued entity.
<fen>Desired_goal</fen> identifies the goal that is not achieved or the entity that is not captured.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>r fails to achieve a <fen>Desired_goal</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Experiencer</fen> fails to achieve a <fen>Desired_goal</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The mouse</fex> eluded the cats for only a few minutes.
The mouse eluded <fex>the cats</fex> for only a few minutes.
Rýmirez-Sýnchez , tried in absentia , had evaded <fex>capture</fex> since the murders in Paris on June 27 , 1975
Smithers got away <fex>at the stroke of midnight</fex>.
At that point <fex>the truck in front of me</fex> turned right into the huge ditch/field that separates the interstate from the access road.
Eventually, though, I backtracked to Kel Tole and hung a <fex>left</fex> toward Kilgal Tole.
Turn right <fex>at the stop light</fex> and follow Park Avenue.
<fex>Mo</fex> dodged the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
Mo dodged <fex> the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust</fex>.
Pat expects <fex>that the Yankees will win the World Series</fex>.
Predictions <fex>about stock prices</fex> are notoriously undependable.
She predicted the outcry <fex>several months ago</fex>.
<fex>Even at the far side of the house</fex> I could predict what was going on the kitchen.
Success had eluded him even i<fex>n his home town</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Che of The Motorcycle Diaries
People's Democratic Republic of the Congo
Compañero: The Life and Death of Che Guevara
